humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size as 2.2 cm, which falls within the range for T2 tumors (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, and in this case, the largest tumor is an invasive ductal carcinoma with a diameter of 2.2 cm. The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma. The T stage is not affected by the number of lymph nodes involved or the presence of metastasis. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathologic tumor stage (pT) is provided directly in the report as pT2. This is determined by the size of the tumor, which in this case is 2.2 cm in diameter. The T stage for breast cancer is defined as follows: T1 (tumor size ≤ 2 cm), T2 (tumor size > 2 cm but ≤ 5 cm), T3 (tumor size > 5 cm), and T4 (tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall or skin). Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T2.
